sentence: Did you hear about corduroy pillows??? theyre making headlines!
explanation: A headline is a title of a news article or report usually printed in large type.
first_new_sentence: The headline of the article captured the attention of many readers.
second_new_sentence: He finally made his mark in the industry by being a headline speaker at the conference.

sentence: I watched two gay guys put up a tent today.... ...that was a camp sight.
explanation: Sight refers to the ability to see or the act of seeing something.
first_new_sentence: Her sight improved significantly after she got new glasses.
second_new_sentence: The stunning sight of the sunset left everyone speechless.

sentence: Gravity makes a terrible friend. its always holding you down.
explanation: Down refers to a direction opposite to the rising sun or a place lower than the current position.
first_new_sentence: The ball rolled down the hill with great speed.
second_new_sentence: She felt down after receiving the disappointing news.

sentence: Each entry includes the original joke setup, the selected word, its explanation, and two serious sentences demonstrating each meaning of the word.
